intro: Zexmenia arnottii f. grisea, commonly known as the grey-flowered zexmenia, is a rare and distinctive plant belonging to the Myrtaceae family. It is characterized by its pale grey or silver-blue leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. Native to the tropical regions of northern Australia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments within rainforests. The plant is noted for its unique foliage and is often found in association with other rainforest flora. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
